Featured Guide
 


Controversial Topics
Resources and tips for researching and writing about issues, including where to start and what to do with the information you've found.

Controversial Topics Guide
  

 
 













				User Services
			







Undergraduate Students
Obtain access to common course-related materials, reserve a study room, or get technology  support.









Graduate Students
Discover tools and services to help you manage your research data and track all of your articles and books.









Faculty 
Find the librarian with expertise in your subject area, or locate course-specific research guides.









Alumni & Community
Learn how to obtain circulation and borrowing privileges, and access open collections in the library




 
 
 




Digital Humanities Center
As the hub of SDSU's Digital Humanities Initiative, the DH Center supports ethical, anti-racist, and anti-oppressive research, teaching, and learning that values the importance of the humanities in the digital age.
Learn more about the DH Center


 












	Student Success Zones







buildIT @SDSU
build IT @SDSU Library is a student-run makerspace designed to foster creativity, encourage innovation, and bring ideas to life.









Math & Stats Center
The Math & Stats Learning Center provides free, on-demand tutoring for SDSU students from all lower division mathematics and statistics courses.









The Writing Center
The Writing Center is a free service for SDSU students and faculty. The tutors are graduate and undergraduate students, trained in tutoring writing.
